welcome.data: Warm-Up Prompt: “Visit a few websites and right-click → Inspect elements like navigation menus, paragraphs, buttons, or images. What kinds of layout differences do you notice between them?” Students discuss in pairs, then share.

aim.data: Objective: Students will identify and apply different CSS display properties (`block`, `inline`, `inline-block`, `none`) and understand their behavior in webpage layout.

review.data: Ask: What happens when you add a `margin`, `padding`, or `width` to an element? Does it always show up? Revisit the box model and how different elements interact with it. Demo: padding on a <span> vs. <div>.

relevant.data: Mini-Lecture and Demo in WebStorm introducing display types: `block`, `inline`, `inline-block`, `none`. Use DevTools to demonstrate each and inspect behavior live.

interactive.data: Students build a layout in WebStorm with four display types and observe changes. Then they comment out the `.none` display to view the hidden element.

ownership.data: Students modify a given HTML structure (nav bar, callout, paragraph) to change display types. Optional challenge: use a toggle button to hide/show with display: none.

resonate.data: Exit Ticket: 1) What's the difference between `inline` and `inline-block`? 2) Why use `display: none` instead of removing an element? 3) What happens when a `block` becomes `inline`?

supplies.data: Computers with WebStorm, Internet access, projector/screen, starter and solution HTML/CSS files.
